instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont turn on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>- 0
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>-5.2V
FB 200,201,3000,3001 WHEN USB connected to one of them they got 5,2 v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont turn on
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont turn on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - GROUNDED

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> - 5,2V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AUX_DET</SIGNAL> - 1,29V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_VDDA</SIGNAL> - 5,05V
<SIGNAL>CHGR_VDDP</SIGNAL> - 5.05V
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> - WHERE I CAN CHECK IT?
<SIGNAL>CHGM_BMON</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>CHGM_AMON</SIGNAL> - 0V

BATTERY NOT CONNECTED

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont turn on
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - GROUNDED"
No need to check for voltages then; find the short...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont turn on
threads.message: OK I CONNECT POWER SUPPLY TO G3H AND FOUND BROKEN <CAPACITOR>C6456</CAPACITOR> I CHANGE IT AND NOW ITS WORKING THANKS A LOT FOR HELP
